segments.content: I'm sorry, sir.  You knew the
doctor pretty well?
Finch nods.
We found this on her bureau, sir.
It's Dr. Surridge's journal.  It
covers her years at Larkhill.  It
might contain the whole story.
Dominic searches for something more to say when Finch does
not answer.
After a moment, Finch looks at the book in Dominic's hand,
then takes it, leafing through the pages.  They flip by, a
breathy sigh, rising to a cold wind.
INT.  LARKHILL MEDICAL RESEARCH BLOCK - DAY - FLASHBACK A younger Dr. Surridge, one by one, administers a series of injections to her research stock.

dialogue.text: INT.  LARKHILL MEDICAL RESEARCH BLOCK - DAY - FLASHBACK A younger Dr. Surridge, one by one, administers a series of injections to her research stock.

segments.content: Prothero has hand picked my
subjects.  Four dozen of them, none
of which will be any use to me if I
don't get to work soon.
She finishes an injection, Prothero encouraging the next
subject.  We recognize her as the woman Prothero pointed at.
They're so weak and pathetic I find
myself hating them.
Delia prepares the next dose, a sour look on her face.
They don't fight or struggle.  Just
stare at you with weak eyes.

Two inmate orderlies are hefting sacked cadavers from a cart

          into an incinerator.
June 9th: Of the original four
dozen, over 75% are now deceased.
Strangely, no clear patterns have
emerged as of yet.
Another body thuds onto the pile.
Batch 5 seems to have no common
discernible effect on any specific
group though the men seem slightly
more resilient than the women.
When it is full, they move to the next door until the cart is
empty.
I'm hoping the survivors will
provide more answers or my time
here will have gone to waste.
Red heat suddenly glows from the oven vents as the orderly
throws a series of switches.

heading.subject: ICAL RESEARCH BLOCK
heading.raw_text: INT.  LARKHILL MEDICAL RESEARCH BLOCK - DAY - FLASHBACK

segments.content:
Dr. Surridge moves down the drab aseptic hallway accompanied

          by an armed guard.  Roman numerals on the doors to each cell

          ascend to five.
June 18: And only five left now.
Two men and three women.  Which
tends to contradict my entry on the
9th.
She pauses at room five.
The man in room five is a
fascinating case.
She looks through the small chicken wire glass window in the
door.
Physically, there doesn't seem to
be anything wrong with him.  No
cellular anomalies, nothing.
In the back, just on the edge of the room's shadow, sits the
man in room five, silently staring back.
Batch five, however, seems to have
brought on some kind of psychotic
breakdown.  He's quite insane.
Dr. Surridge can't seem to break her stare.
He has this way of looking through
you.  Reverend Lilliman won't go
near him.  He claims that it is the
devil in room five.  I see him
cross himself whenever he passes
his door.  Still, there's something
about him...

Dr. Surridge slowly moves through the Larkhill garden, an

          incredible abundance of fruits, vegetables and violet carson

          roses.
I'm glad Prothero let room five
have a go at the gardening project.
He is quite proficient.  Prothero
was reluctant to allow an inmate
access to the tool and chemical
supply at first but now the fat
toad is delighted.  The crop has
almost doubled.
She traces the petals of a rose with her finger.
He also grows roses.  Beautiful
roses.

Dr. Surridge and several other Larkhill appointees relax

          after dinner.
December 24th: I was in the mess.
It was about half past ten when we
heard the first explosion.
A massive explosion shakes the building to its very core, its
windows shattering and hooded pendulum lights swinging.

Men and women clutch at their throats as they tumble out into

          the yard.
The ones at the front ran straight
into the gas.  It was horrible.
They drop to the ground, gasping and vomiting.
The back door is kicked open, Dr. Surridge following two
guards.
A few of us made it out through the
rear door.  You could hear men
screaming everywhere.  I hate the
sound of men screaming.
She looks out, men running, collapsing, dying in a yellow
green haze that seems everywhere.
In the center of the camp,
everything was on fire.  Everyone
running in all directions.  We had
hardly enough time to get our
bearings when the ovens exploded.
Another explosion wracks the compound.  The pillar of flame
rises into the black sky, dwarfing the men in the camp.
Dr. Surridge sees a gaping hole in the medical block, its
insides turned out like an unholy birth.
It was the man in room rive.  I
couldn't have known.  The chemical
supplies, grease solvents, ammonia,
fertilizer.  He'd been making
things with them.
Close on a soldier, doubled over, hacking up bile.
A sticky blue fire licks up from a blackened body like a dura flame.

dialogue.text: A sticky blue fire licks up from a blackened body like a dura flame.

segments.content: Dr. Surridge turns as a silhouette crosses the yard, backlit by a curtain of fire.

dialogue.text: Dr. Surridge turns as a silhouette crosses the yard, backlit by a curtain of fire.

segments.content: And in the yard, I saw him.  He had
the flames behind him.  He was
naked.
The man stops.
Dr. Surridge seems to wilt under his stare but cannot look away.

dialogue.text: Dr. Surridge seems to wilt under his stare but cannot look away.

segments.content: As if I were an insect.  Oh god.
As if I were something mounted on a
slide.
The flames convulse hypnotically behind him.
INT.  LEADER'S OFFICE Finch snaps Dr. Surridge's journal shut. He sits in front of the Leader's desk puffing on his pipe while Susan stares coldly.

dialogue.text: INT.  LEADER'S OFFICE Finch snaps Dr. Surridge's journal shut. He sits in front of the Leader's desk puffing on his pipe while Susan stares coldly.

segments.content: That's the last entry until six
months later when Dr. Surridge is
back in London.  There is no
mention of the man in room five
again.  End of story.
He tosses the journal on Susan's desk.
Except that it wasn't the end of
the story.
Finch rises, crossing to the wastebasket.
Between 2009 and 2012, over forty
men and women who were previously
stationed at Larkhill met with what
were believed to be accidental
deaths.  Eventually, only three
remained.
He taps his pipe into his hand, pouring the contents into the
wastebasket.
The three he'd been saving until
last.
Finch brushes the ashes from his hands and begins repacking
his pipe.
Everyone who worked at Larkhill.
Everyone who could have identified
him.  You see there are two
possible motives here.  Not one.
Susan raises his head.
The first is revenge.  He escapes
from Larkhill and vows to get even
with his tormentors.  The whole
exercise an elaborate, chilling
vendetta.
When he finishes repacking the pipe, he replaces it in his
mouth.
That's the explanation that I find
most reassuring, funnily enough.
Because that means he's finished.
Finch begins relighting his pipe.

dialogue.text: Finch begins relighting his pipe.

segments.content: The second motive is more sinister.
Like I said, everyone who could
have identified him is dead.
A flame leaps into the air.
What if he's just been clearing the
ground?
Another burst.
What if he's planning something
else?
The lighter slips back into his pocket.
You see, the diary we found was in
full view.  We didn't have to
search for it.  He left it there.
He wanted us to find it.  He wanted
us to know the story.  Or...
Finch returns to his chair, letting out a huge cloud.
For all we know, the diary could be
a complete and utter fake.
Codename V could have written it
himself.
Finch leans forward.
He's playing games with us.  He
might never have been at Larkhill
at all.  Do you see?  It could all
be another smoke screen, a false
trail, another cover story --
Susan punches the desk.

dialogue.text: Susan punches the desk.

segments.content: Mr. Finch, would you please explain
to me the nature of this meeting?!
Because I was under the impression
that you had some information about
the terrorist, codename V!
And punches it again until his fist hurts.
No more questions, understand!  I
want answers!  I am not interested
in where he grew up, what kind of
flowers he likes or his favorite
color!
Susan's collar chokes his face to an unnatural crimson.
Do I make myself clear?
After a moment, Finch stands, Susan hanging on his last word.

dialogue.text: After a moment, Finch stands, Susan hanging on his last word.

segments.content: Dismissed.  England prevails, Mr.
Finch turns, Susan calling after him as he leaves.

dialogue.text: Finch turns, Susan calling after him as he leaves.

segments.content: Mr. Finch, the girl.  Do you have
anything on the girl?
Finch pauses at the door.
INT.  CELL Evey stirs as voices drift in from the hall outside her door.

dialogue.text: INT.  CELL Evey stirs as voices drift in from the hall outside her door.

segments.content: Three guards are silhouetted in the doorway of a cramped jail cell.  Still sluggish from the chloroform, Evey looks down at the coarse slipover she's now wearing. One of the men, Rossiter, crosses toward Evey, swinging a pair of shackles.  He grabs Evey, slamming her face down into the hard cot, driving a knee between her shoulder blades. Evey screams.

dialogue.text: Three guards are silhouetted in the doorway of a cramped jail cell.  Still sluggish from the chloroform, Evey looks down at the coarse slipover she's now wearing. One of the men, Rossiter, crosses toward Evey, swinging a pair of shackles.  He grabs Evey, slamming her face down into the hard cot, driving a knee between her shoulder blades. Evey screams.

segments.content: Tsk.  This pathetic whore is the
famous Miss Hammond?
The shackles bite down on her wrists as they laugh in the
hall.
Rossiter stands her up, shoving her into the wall.

dialogue.text: Rossiter stands her up, shoving her into the wall.

segments.content: Shut up.
He slides a thick hood over her head.

dialogue.text: He slides a thick hood over her head.

segments.content: INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM The hood is lifted from her head.  Evey squints hard, awash in a blinding, burning light. A man sits, unmoving, at a desk across from her, a guard at his side, both backlit by a harsh white kliegs. Evey's eyes start to water as she blinks.

dialogue.text: INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM The hood is lifted from her head.  Evey squints hard, awash in a blinding, burning light. A man sits, unmoving, at a desk across from her, a guard at his side, both backlit by a harsh white kliegs. Evey's eyes start to water as she blinks.

segments.content: Do you know why you're here.  Evey
Hammond?
No, please, I didn't do anything.
Allow me to be more precise.  Did
you participate in the murder of
Dr. Delia Surridge?
No.
Did you participate in the murder
of Derek Almond, director of the
Finger?
No, I --
Did you participate in the murder
of Bishop Anthony Lilliman?
Oh god, I don't --
Have you ever participated in a
terrorist act against your country?
No --
What is the identity of codename V?
I don't know.

A monitor next to the desk lights up.  From the snowy static, an image begins to form. A girl is talking to a man.  She is shoving her hips at him, propositioning him.  When more men appear from the alley, Evey realizes she is watching herself.

dialogue.text: A monitor next to the desk lights up.  From the snowy static, an image begins to form. A girl is talking to a man.  She is shoving her hips at him, propositioning him.  When more men appear from the alley, Evey realizes she is watching herself.

segments.content: They were going to rape me, kill
me --
Rossiter grabs a handful of her hair.
She swallows hard when she sees V emerge on the screen.  The image freezes on his smiling face.

dialogue.text: She swallows hard when she sees V emerge on the screen.  The image freezes on his smiling face.

segments.content: This board will not tolerate any
more of your lies, Miss Hammond.
We have over 120 minutes of audio
and videotape and 75 pages of
testimonials from eye witness that
identify you as an accomplice to
the terrorist, codename V.
The monitor blinks off.
Do you want to know why you're
here?  You are formally being
brought up on charges of murder on
fourteen counts and sedition
against your Leader and country
which brings an automatic sentence
of death.
Please.  I didn't do anything.
Process the prisoner and return her
to her cell until she is more
cooperative.
Rossiter slips the hood back over Evey's head.

Evey cries as a rough hand runs a pair of electric clippers

          over her head.  Huge sheaves of her hair fall to the ground.

Evey lies crumpled on the hard floor, unmoving, as a tray of

          food is slid through a slot at the bottom of the door.

          She watches as a rat crosses from a hole in the wall,

          sniffing the murky rendered gelatin in the wooden bowl.

Evey hangs limply from a set of manacles as she is washed and

          deloused by heavy hands.

          She coughs in the yellow bug powder cloud as it burns her

          eyes and the red welts on her back.

Evey is curled up on the cot like a dry fetus, now gaunt arms

          wrapped around her legs.  She blinks when she hears something

          moving in the rat hole.

          Evey raises her head as something is pushed through the

          crevice.

          Tentative fingers search the hole, pulling out a length of

          toilet paper.  Over every inch of it is a delicately scrawled

          message.

          We move into the rathole, its edges slowly filling the frame

          until black.

Pull back from a shadow, the outline of the interrogator's

          silhouette against sharp light coming into frame.
I read her letter.  Hid it.  Slept.
Woke.  They questioned me.  And I
read her letter again.
Rossiter is buckling Evey's thin arms and legs into a chair.
Her now frail frame can barely hold up the frayed brown
slipover.
On the table in front of her, there is a large wash basin of water.  Rossiter dunks her head into it.

dialogue.text: On the table in front of her, there is a large wash basin of water.  Rossiter dunks her head into it.

segments.content: INT.  CLASSROOM - DAY - FLASHBACK A teacher reads from her lesson plan in front of rows and rows of uniformed pubescences in this all girl private school.  Her voice drones on and on like Muzak.

dialogue.text: INT.  CLASSROOM - DAY - FLASHBACK A teacher reads from her lesson plan in front of rows and rows of uniformed pubescences in this all girl private school.  Her voice drones on and on like Muzak.

segments.content: I was born in a rainy burg in
Nottingham in 1975.  I passed my
eleven plus and went to girl's
grammar.
A blonde tomboy sneaks a smile to her curly haired friend
next to her.
I met my first girlfriend at
school.  Her name was Sara.  Her
wrists.  Her wrists were beautiful.
Her hand slides across the desk, fingers tickling the young
flesh of Sara's wrist.
The teacher's voice slows, dropping octaves, becoming --
A man's voice.
I sat in biology class staring at
the pickled rabbit fetus while Mr.
Herd said it was an adolescent
phase that people outgrew.
Valerie looks at Sara across the room, her head down in
shame.
INT.  LIVING ROOM - DAY - FLASHBACK Two teenage girls stand in front of a middle aged couple. They are holding hands.

dialogue.text: INT.  LIVING ROOM - DAY - FLASHBACK Two teenage girls stand in front of a middle aged couple. They are holding hands.

segments.content: In 1994, I stopped pretending and
took a girl called Christine home
to meet my parents.
The greying woman repeats the sign of the cross over and
over, sobbing into a handkerchief.  Her husband's face is
contorted in disgust.
A week later I moved to London to
go to college and study drama.  My
mother said I broke her heart.

Two young women cuddle on a park bench under a London summer

          sky, feeding the pigeons.
But it was my integrity that was
important.  Is that so selfish?  It
sells for so little but it's all we
have left in this place...
The black haired girl nibbles on the blonde's ear.
INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM Evey struggles against Rossiter's weight who keeps her head submerged.

character.name: It is the very last inch of us...

dialogue.text: INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM Evey struggles against Rossiter's weight who keeps her head submerged.

segments.content: But within that inch we are free.
Rossiter wrenches back and Evey sucks hard for air, coughing out water.

dialogue.text: Rossiter wrenches back and Evey sucks hard for air, coughing out water.

segments.content: Now Miss Hammond, let us review the
facts.
Evey stares at him, eyes red, heart pounding in her ears.
You work for codename V.  Codename
V killed Delia Surridge and then
Derek Almond with your help and
that is why you were found outside
her home.
Evey begins to shake her head, water sluicing off her thin
face.
Isn't that what happened, Miss
Hammond?
No.  No, that isn't true --
Rossiter grabs Evey's neck --

dialogue.text: Rossiter grabs Evey's neck --

segments.content: Plunging her head into the bowl.  Water fills Evey's nose and ears.

dialogue.text: Plunging her head into the bowl.  Water fills Evey's nose and ears.

segments.content: INT.  THEATRE - NIGHT - FLASHBACK The packed house watches as a Prince kneels before a woman's bare foot with a slipper of glass.

character.name: London.  I was happy in London.

dialogue.text: INT.  THEATRE - NIGHT - FLASHBACK The packed house watches as a Prince kneels before a woman's bare foot with a slipper of glass.

segments.content: The woman glances into the dark sea of faces.

dialogue.text: The woman glances into the dark sea of faces.

segments.content: The world was strange and rustling
with invisible crowds behind the
hot lights and all that breathless
glamour.

Two women weep in each other's arms, embracing in a perfect

          knee high meadow.
Work improved.  I got small film
roles, then bigger ones.
The blonde woman brushes away a tear from the other's cheek.
In 2006, I starred in "The Salt
Flats."  That's where I met Ruth.

We pull back and see we are on location for a movie and the two women are being filmed. INT.  CONDO - NIGHT - FLASHBACK Ruth and Valerie sit on the couch watching television.  On the table behind them is a bouquet of violet carson roses.

dialogue.text: We pull back and see we are on location for a movie and the two women are being filmed. INT.  CONDO - NIGHT - FLASHBACK Ruth and Valerie sit on the couch watching television.  On the table behind them is a bouquet of violet carson roses.

segments.content: Every Valentine's Day she sent me
roses and, oh god, we had so much.
Those were the best three years of
my life.
The two women stare at the newscast in tears, the sound of
marching coming from the set's speakers.
EXT.  LONDON STREET - DAY - FLASHBACK The sound of marching explodes as columns of men in brown uniforms and jack boots fill the streets.

dialogue.text: EXT.  LONDON STREET - DAY - FLASHBACK The sound of marching explodes as columns of men in brown uniforms and jack boots fill the streets.

segments.content: And after that there were no more
roses...

Rossiter presses his elbow onto Evey's neck, holding her

          submerged.
Rossiter lets Evey up.  Her red burnt lungs gulp at the air.

dialogue.text: Rossiter lets Evey up.  Her red burnt lungs gulp at the air.

segments.content: After the takeover, they started
rounding up the gays.  They took
Ruth while she was out looking for
food.
Evey blinks hard, black fireworks exploding in her eyes.
She wheezes, on the edge of unconsciousness.

character.name: Why are they so frightened of us?

dialogue.text: She wheezes, on the edge of unconsciousness.

segments.content: They burned her face with
cigarettes and made her give them
my name.  She signed a statement
saying I'd seduced her.
The interrogator's voice melts into a slag heap of sound with
the hot, rhythmic pounding in her ears.
I didn't blame her.  God, I loved
her but I didn't blame her.
Rossiter uncuffs Evey, slipping the black bag over her head.
Evey's knees buckle as he forces her to stand.

dialogue.text: Evey's knees buckle as he forces her to stand.

segments.content: She killed herself in her cell.
She couldn't live with betraying
me, with giving up that last inch.
Evey weaves down the hall.  Rossiter shoving her from behind.

dialogue.text: Evey weaves down the hall.  Rossiter shoving her from behind.

segments.content: They came for me.  They shaved off
my hair.  They held my head down a
toilet and told lesbian jokes.
They brought me here and pumped me
full of chemicals.
The cell door swings open.
I can't feel my tongue.  I can't
speak.
Rossiter yanks the hood from her head and pushes her in.
It is strange that my life should
end in such a terrible place but
for three years I had roses and
apologized to nobody.
The iron door slams shut, lock ringing in the stale air.
I shall die here.  Every inch of me
shall perish...
Evey rolls to her knees.
She crawls for the rat hole.

dialogue.text: She crawls for the rat hole.

segments.content: An inch.  It is small and fragile
and it's the only thing in the
world that's worth having.
Her shaking hand pulls the letter from the stone crevice.
We must never lose it or sell it or
give it away.  We must never let
them take it from us.
Evey clutches it like a rosary as she begins to cry.
I don't know who you are but I hope
you escape this place.  I hope that
the world turns and things get
better and that one day people have
roses again.
She holds the note to her face, her tears soaking into the
fragile paper.
I don't know who you are but I love
you.  I love you.  Valerie.
Slowly, Evey slips away, succumbing to blackness.
I had come to know every inch of
those four walls in that dark hell
and they knew every inch of me.
INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM Loud lights blare against Evey's solemn face.

dialogue.text: INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM Loud lights blare against Evey's solemn face.

segments.content: A typed document sits on a small tray table in front of her.

dialogue.text: A typed document sits on a small tray table in front of her.

segments.content: "My name is Evey Hammond.  On the
5th of November 2019, I was
abducted by the terrorist known as
codename V and then taken against
my will to an unknown location."
Rossiter hovers just behind her as the Interrogator reads her
confession.
"Once there, I was systematically
brainwashed by means physical and
psychological.  I was frequently
subjected to sexual abuse during
this period."
Evey's expression is unchanging.
"Eventually I was terrorized into
helping him commit the murders of
Derek Almond, Dr. Delia Surridge,
and Anthony Lilliman, Bishop of
Rossiter drops a pen on the table.

dialogue.text: Rossiter drops a pen on the table.

segments.content: "I, the undersigned, swear that the
above statement is genuine and that
it was not signed by means of
intimidation."
The pen slowly rocks to a stop.
We'd like you to sign that for us,
Miss Hammond.  Where we've put the
little cross.
She blinks.
No.
Rossiter begins unbuckling Evey's restraints.

dialogue.text: Rossiter begins unbuckling Evey's restraints.

segments.content: Escort Miss Hammond back to her
cell, Rossiter, where she will wait
while you arrange a wet detail of
six men.
He forces Evey to her feet.
Then take her out behind the
chemical sheds and shoot her.

The door opens behind Evey as she rereads Valerie's letter

          for the last time.
It's time, unless you want to
change your mind.
She holds the tattered piece of toilet paper to her chest.
Sign that statement.  You could be
out inside three years.  Perhaps
they'd find you a job with the
Evey closes her eyes.

dialogue.text: Evey closes her eyes.

segments.content: Thank you but I'd rather die behind
the chemical sheds.
Her last words hang in the air.
Then there's nothing left to
threaten you with, is there?  You
are free.
He turns and leaves.

She listens as his footsteps fade down the hall, the door hanging weirdly open. Evey takes a few tentative steps toward the door and sticks her head out into the empty hall, peering down both ways. Slowly, she emerges from her cell, retracing her path down the hall that her blindfold never allowed her to see. Quietly inching along the wall, Evey peeks around a corner, gasping at the rigid guard standing off to the side.  There is something about the man's frozen stare that keeps her from running. Evey straightens and crosses to the guard. It is a mannequin. She touches him, the wheeled platform he is mounted on rolling back against the wall. INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM The door creaks open as Evey enters the room where for so long she was questioned and tortured. She crosses to the frozen Interrogator sitting at his desk. Her finger brushes lightly against the plastic hand, then Evey raps a knuckle on his hollow wooden head.  Around his neck a small speaker hangs from a cord. Evey drifts uneasily into a back room where a discarded prison guard's uniform hangs on a rack.  On a table next to a wig and pair of gloves, the rat looks up at her through the bars of its tiny cage. She moves through another door, the wind suddenly knocked from her chest as she finally sees where her prison was built -- INT.  SHADOW GALLERY V steps from the shadows.

dialogue.text: She listens as his footsteps fade down the hall, the door hanging weirdly open. Evey takes a few tentative steps toward the door and sticks her head out into the empty hall, peering down both ways. Slowly, she emerges from her cell, retracing her path down the hall that her blindfold never allowed her to see. Quietly inching along the wall, Evey peeks around a corner, gasping at the rigid guard standing off to the side.  There is something about the man's frozen stare that keeps her from running. Evey straightens and crosses to the guard. It is a mannequin. She touches him, the wheeled platform he is mounted on rolling back against the wall. INT.  INTERROGATION ROOM The door creaks open as Evey enters the room where for so long she was questioned and tortured. She crosses to the frozen Interrogator sitting at his desk. Her finger brushes lightly against the plastic hand, then Evey raps a knuckle on his hollow wooden head.  Around his neck a small speaker hangs from a cord. Evey drifts uneasily into a back room where a discarded prison guard's uniform hangs on a rack.  On a table next to a wig and pair of gloves, the rat looks up at her through the bars of its tiny cage. She moves through another door, the wind suddenly knocked from her chest as she finally sees where her prison was built -- INT.  SHADOW GALLERY V steps from the shadows.

segments.content: Welcome home, Evey.
Her mouth hangs open.

dialogue.text: Her mouth hangs open.

segments.content: Evey's rail thin figure begins to shake.

dialogue.text: Evey's rail thin figure begins to shake.

segments.content: She stumbles against the wall, unable to support herself.

dialogue.text: She stumbles against the wall, unable to support herself.

segments.content: You -- You hit me and -- and cut my
hair.  It was you.  It was just you
all this time.
She doubles over, covering her face as she bursts into tears.
Evey looks up at him, body shivering as he quietly glides toward her.

character.name: You tortured me.  You tortured me --

dialogue.text: Evey looks up at him, body shivering as he quietly glides toward her.

segments.content: Oh god, why?
Because I love you, Evey.  Because
I wanted to set you free.
A look of horror twists her starved face.

dialogue.text: A look of horror twists her starved face.

segments.content: Slender fingers ball into fists.

character.name: Set me free?  Don't you realize?

dialogue.text: Slender fingers ball into fists.

segments.content: Don't you realize what you did to
me?  You nearly drove me mad!
Disgust and anger light up her eyes.
Her little, wiry body coils tight as she circles him.

dialogue.text: Her little, wiry body coils tight as she circles him.

segments.content: I hate you!  Set me free?  You put
me in a prison to set me free?!
You were already in a prison.
You've been in a prison all your
life.
Shut up!  I don't want to hear it.
I wasn't in a prison.  I was happy!
I was happy here --
Happiness is the most insidious
prison of all, Evey.
That's warped!  That's evil and
it's wrong!  What gives you the
right to judge?  Who are you to say
what's not good enough?!
You were born in a prison, Evey.  I
didn't put you there.  I just
showed you the bars.  You've been
in a prison so long, you no longer
believe there's an outside world.
She wheels away from him, covering her ears, trying to get
away from his voice.
Shut up!  You're mad!  I don't want
to hear it!
That's because you're afraid, Evey.
You're afraid because you can feel
freedom closing in on you.  You're
afraid because freedom is
terrifying.
Evey falls, stumbling through the labyrinth of the Shadow
Gallery.
I can't feel anything!  There's
nothing left to feel!  Don't you
understand?
Don't back away from it, Evey.
Part of you understands the truth
even as part pretends not to.
She collapses, head pounding.
Woman, this is the most important
moment in your life.  Don't run
from it.
I don't know what -- Oh god -- I
can't breathe --
V couches next to her.
Good.  You're almost there.  Go
closer.  Feel the shape of it.
What are you doing to me?  I can't
breathe --
You were in a cell.  They offered
you a choice between the death of
your principles and the death of
your body.
He cradles her as she hyperventilates, tears streaming down
her face.
I feel -- I feel like I'm going to
burst.
You said you'd rather die.  You
faced the fear of your own death
and you were calm.  Try to feel now
what you felt then.
The mask hovers over her.

dialogue.text: The mask hovers over her.

segments.content: He squeezes her shuddering body.

dialogue.text: He squeezes her shuddering body.

segments.content: Oh god, V, I'm so scared.  What's
happening to me?
The door of the cage is open, Evey.
All that you feel is the wind from
outside.  Don't be afraid.
Gently, he lifts her.
Try to walk.  The lift will take us
to the roof.
He helps her to an open elevator.

dialogue.text: He helps her to an open elevator.

segments.content: I -- I don't want to be
blindfolded.

The cage in the elevator rattles shut. EXT.  ROOF - NIGHT The two figures stand in the door of the roof access, a raging tempest oozing from a split sky. Something draws Evey out into the storm. Slowly, she walks beneath it, the wind and rain pounding against her thin frame.  Evey lets the coarse slipover fall to the ground and stares straight up into the storm, naked, the elements soaking into her very being. V moves up behind her.

dialogue.text: The cage in the elevator rattles shut. EXT.  ROOF - NIGHT The two figures stand in the door of the roof access, a raging tempest oozing from a split sky. Something draws Evey out into the storm. Slowly, she walks beneath it, the wind and rain pounding against her thin frame.  Evey lets the coarse slipover fall to the ground and stares straight up into the storm, naked, the elements soaking into her very being. V moves up behind her.

segments.content: Do you feel it?
Everything's so -- different.
I know.  Five years ago, I too
stared beneath a night like this.
A low rumble of thunder washes over London.

dialogue.text: A low rumble of thunder washes over London.

segments.content: The night is yours, Evey.  Seize
it.  Encircle it within your arms.
His words buffet against her with the sheets of rain.
Bury it in your heart up to the
hilt.
She raises her arms to embrace the raging torrent.
Become transfixed and
transfigured --
A jagged bolt of lightning shatters the sky.
EXT.  NEW GOVERNMENT BUILDING Finch gets out of a police car and looks up the black face of the modern building.  He sighs and taps his pipe against the heel of his shoe.

dialogue.text: EXT.  NEW GOVERNMENT BUILDING Finch gets out of a police car and looks up the black face of the modern building.  He sighs and taps his pipe against the heel of his shoe.

segments.content: Finch turns to find Dascombe hurrying towards him.

dialogue.text: Finch turns to find Dascombe hurrying towards him.

segments.content: Do you know what this is all about?
No, but I can guess.
What?
"Remember, remember, the fifth of
November."
Oh come on.  He's long gone.  He
has to be.  He did what he came to
do and it's over.
Finch chews on his pipe.
Isn't it?
He turns and heads into the building.

dialogue.text: He turns and heads into the building.

segments.content: A dark November sky hangs like a shroud over the building.
INT.  COUNCIL CONFERENCE ROOM The heads of each department are gathered around a table of black granite. Peter Creedy, sitting back out of the lights, is the new head of the Finger.

dialogue.text: INT.  COUNCIL CONFERENCE ROOM The heads of each department are gathered around a table of black granite. Peter Creedy, sitting back out of the lights, is the new head of the Finger.

segments.content: I have given you almost a year and
you have given me nothing.
He glares at Finch.

dialogue.text: He glares at Finch.

segments.content: Now Adam, there is no one better
than Finch and you know it.
Yes, Mr. Dascombe, I do know it.
It is that very fact that keeps me
awake at night, wondering if
perhaps there is a reason that Mr.
Finch has failed.

Finch ignores the Leader.
I've read Delia's diary over and
over all year.  It sickens me but I
am unable to judge her.  I am as
guilty as she.
Mr. Finch, what are you doing?
Shoot him.  Kill the bastard,
Finch.
I have no excuse.  I did what I was
told to do.
Finch, I order you to shoot him!
Finch!
My job was to find you and catch
you.  I've done my job.  I've done
it for the last time.  I'm tired of
it.  I'm tired of it all.
He tosses the gun to the Leader.
The Leader seethes, his eyes boring into Finch.

character.name: Kill him yourself if you can.

dialogue.text: The Leader seethes, his eyes boring into Finch.

segments.content: Thank you, V.  And goodbye.
The machine gun burst shatters the quiet concrete silence. Finch falls dead at V's feet.

dialogue.text: The machine gun burst shatters the quiet concrete silence. Finch falls dead at V's feet.

segments.content: I warned you, Finch, the penalty
for treason is death.
He aims the gun at V.
Are you ready to die?
The Leader laughs.

character.name: The real question is, are you?

dialogue.text: The Leader laughs.

segments.content: Do you really believe you can pick
up that knife before I pull this
trigger?

Almost casually, V bends down to pick up the knife -- The Leader screams and fires. Bullets knock V back a bit but he continues, grabbing the knife and standing. Eyes widening with disbelief, the Leader fires another blast as V begins walking towards him. The machine gun roars, bullets shredding out through the back of V's cloak as he continues with short deliberate steps until -- The hammer clicks against the pin.  The gun is empty. V stands before him.

character.name: No.  But I don't have to.

dialogue.text: Almost casually, V bends down to pick up the knife -- The Leader screams and fires. Bullets knock V back a bit but he continues, grabbing the knife and standing. Eyes widening with disbelief, the Leader fires another blast as V begins walking towards him. The machine gun roars, bullets shredding out through the back of V's cloak as he continues with short deliberate steps until -- The hammer clicks against the pin.  The gun is empty. V stands before him.

segments.content: You see?  You cannot kill me.
There is no flesh and blood within
this cloak to kill.  There is only
an idea.
V smiles.

The Leader screams. V drives the knife into his heart, killing him instantly. V stands alone amidst the carnage and seeping pools of red. His body wavers.  He takes his hands out from beneath his cloak and reveals his gloves, wet with blood. INT.  CONRAD'S HOUSE The front door opens and Helen enters.

dialogue.text: The Leader screams. V drives the knife into his heart, killing him instantly. V stands alone amidst the carnage and seeping pools of red. His body wavers.  He takes his hands out from beneath his cloak and reveals his gloves, wet with blood. INT.  CONRAD'S HOUSE The front door opens and Helen enters.

segments.content: Creedy?  Creedy, you dumb bastard,
you left your car parked in front.
She walks up the stairs to the bedroom.
INT.  BEDROOM She steps into the room, her sole and heel sinking into the plush carpet soaked with blood.

character.name: What did I tell you?  Creedy.

dialogue.text: INT.  BEDROOM She steps into the room, her sole and heel sinking into the plush carpet soaked with blood.

segments.content: When she sees Creedy's head mashed open, she covers her mouth.

dialogue.text: When she sees Creedy's head mashed open, she covers her mouth.

segments.content: Conrad has propped himself against the bed.

dialogue.text: Conrad has propped himself against the bed.

segments.content: Conrad!  What have you done?
I won, Helen.  I did it.  I won.
He crawls toward her, slipping on the wet carpet.

dialogue.text: He crawls toward her, slipping on the wet carpet.

segments.content: We've been through a bad patch,
Helen.  But now, he's gone...
There's nothing to come between
us...
He reaches for her foot, his hand gloved with wet red.
Don't touch me!  You stupid piece
of shit!  You've ruined it!  I had
it all planned perfectly and you've
ruined it!
She checks her watch; two hours to midnight.
I have to get out of here!  I have
to get away!
Conrad seizes hold of her ankle.
Helen --
The look in his eyes frightens her.  She tries to kick free of him but he won't let go.  Twisting, she reaches for the door but slips on the carpet.

dialogue.text: The look in his eyes frightens her.  She tries to kick free of him but he won't let go.  Twisting, she reaches for the door but slips on the carpet.

segments.content: Conrad, damn you!  Let me go!
No, Helen, you're not leaving me...
not this time... not ever.
He crawls up her body still clutching the bloody knife.
No, please!  Oh god, no!  Oh god,
please help me!
Conrad raises the knife.
No one can help us, Helen.  God is
dead.
The knife falls.
Evey hears V on the spiral staircase.

Scarlet footprints trail behind V as he struggles down the

          stairs.
He nods and then collapses, rolling down the rest of the stairs.

dialogue.text: He nods and then collapses, rolling down the rest of the stairs.

segments.content:
Running to him, she falls to his side.  His clothes are slick

          with blood.
Oh god, what happened?
Evey...
You need a doctor.
It's too late for that...
No, don't say that!
Evey, listen to me.  I've not long
and there are things that must be
said.
His voice strains beneath the mask.
I have done that which I came to
do.  Now, it is time for me to rest
and with me the past will, at last,
find peace.
Trembling, Evey holds him.
But the world, the world is not
saved... Do not think that, when
the fires die and the smoke clears,
there is no miracle... there is
only a path... upon which they must
learn to rule themselves.
Yes, they need you, V.
Not me, Evey, not me.  I told you I
am the villain.  The destroyer...
He reaches up and wipes a tear from her cheek.

character.name: But yes, they will need help...

dialogue.text: He reaches up and wipes a tear from her cheek.

segments.content: I kept my promise to you, Evey...
Now you must promise me.
What?
Promise me... you will discover the
face under this mask... but you
will never look beneath it.
I don't understand.
Promise me.  Please...
I promise.
Sweet Eve.  Wherever I shall go, I
shall always love you.
V, you are not going anywhere!
Midnight... Midnight.  Eve... Make
them remember...
You're not going to die, V!
Let me be there, Evey, when it
begins... Please, let me hear the
music, one last time... my music...
I won't let you die!
I know you won't... I know...

Holding him as tight as she can, she feels his life drain away, slipping through her arms in the way the last grains of sand pour through the neck of the hourglass. She buries her face beside his and weeps. EXT.  CITY STREET An enormous crowd has begun to gather in the streets surrounding the New Government Building.  With the crowd, a restlessness swells against each barricade erected by the military. A sergeant stands on an armored car, speaking through a megaphone.

dialogue.text: Holding him as tight as she can, she feels his life drain away, slipping through her arms in the way the last grains of sand pour through the neck of the hourglass. She buries her face beside his and weeps. EXT.  CITY STREET An enormous crowd has begun to gather in the streets surrounding the New Government Building.  With the crowd, a restlessness swells against each barricade erected by the military. A sergeant stands on an armored car, speaking through a megaphone.

segments.content: Return to your homes!  There is
nothing to see!  The terrorist is
dead!
He ain't dead!
INT.  SHADOW GALLERY Evey huddles against the stair railing, her face tear stained, staring at the lifeless body of V.

character.name: He'll be here, just like he said!

dialogue.text: INT.  SHADOW GALLERY Evey huddles against the stair railing, her face tear stained, staring at the lifeless body of V.

segments.content: I remember... I remember staring at
the mask, at that smile.
She touches the mask, her fingers finding its edge.
Part of me couldn't believe he was
dead and maybe that was why.  The
smile was still the same.
It made me want to tear it off so I
could see the face, so I could see
that he was dead.
Her fingers stop.
But I had promised.
You will discover the face under
this mask but you will never look
beneath it.
I began to try to imagine his face.
Of course, I had long pictured my
father behind that smile but I knew
in my heart that V was not my
father.
Evey stares into the eyes, the dark, empty eyes.
Yet every time I pictured another
face, any face, something was lost,
something important was somehow
diminished.  V was more than a
face.  V was V.
Her expression changes.
And then, quite suddenly, quite
naturally, I realized whose face
must be beneath that mask.  It was
the only face that mattered.
I won't let you die.

A small smile creeps across her face. EXT.  CITY STREET Midnight approaches and the crowd feels it.  Spilling everywhere, they fill the streets like a flood. INT.  TRAIN CAR Evey sets a final violet carson on the chest of V.  He is lying on a bed made of gelignite, covered in roses. Touching his mask, she bends over him.

character.name: I know you won't... I know.

dialogue.text: A small smile creeps across her face. EXT.  CITY STREET Midnight approaches and the crowd feels it.  Spilling everywhere, they fill the streets like a flood. INT.  TRAIN CAR Evey sets a final violet carson on the chest of V.  He is lying on a bed made of gelignite, covered in roses. Touching his mask, she bends over him.

segments.content: Tenderly, she presses her lips to the smile, her eyes closing, her final tears blinking free. She backs away and V smiles, his lips wet with her kiss, his cheek wet with her tears.

dialogue.text: Tenderly, she presses her lips to the smile, her eyes closing, her final tears blinking free. She backs away and V smiles, his lips wet with her kiss, his cheek wet with her tears.

segments.content: "Ave Atque vale."
On the train platform, Evey reaches through the window and
starts the train.
The wheels churn as the train lurches forward.

character.name: I looked it up the next morning.

dialogue.text: The wheels churn as the train lurches forward.

segments.content: "Hail and farewell."
"Make them remember..."
She watches the train disappear into the tunnel.
EXT.  CITY STREET The crowd surges against a barricade when a voice cries out across the city echoing through the megaphone on every corner.

character.name: They will, my love.  They will.

dialogue.text: EXT.  CITY STREET The crowd surges against a barricade when a voice cries out across the city echoing through the megaphone on every corner.

segments.content: "Remember, remember, the fifth of

High above the gathered mass, a masked figure steps out onto a roof parapet. The crowd explodes. INT.  SUBWAY The train barrels along, screaming against its rusted rails. EXT.  ROOFTOP Dressed as V, Evey stands on the roof's edge, speaking into a microphone.

dialogue.text: High above the gathered mass, a masked figure steps out onto a roof parapet. The crowd explodes. INT.  SUBWAY The train barrels along, screaming against its rusted rails. EXT.  ROOFTOP Dressed as V, Evey stands on the roof's edge, speaking into a microphone.

segments.content: I have come here tonight to keep a
promise.  A promise that is over
four hundred years old.  Tonight I
am here to give you your freedom!
Again, the crowd bursts into a frenzy.
Since mankind's dawn a handful of
oppressors have accepted the
responsibility over our lives,
responsibility that we should have
accepted ourselves.  By doing so,
they took our power.  By doing
nothing, we gave it away.
The voice booms over the mesmerized crowd.
Tonight, our world will change.
Our leaders will be gone and we

heading.subject: must choose what comes next.  A
heading.raw_text: must choose what comes next.  A

segments.content: return to the chains of others or
lives of our own.  A world of the
past or one of the future.
She feels the sea of humanity beneath her, almost channeling
their energy.
Let us choose carefully, London,
and when we do, let us mark well
and remember, remember this fifth
of November!
The crowd screams as one and their scream becomes --

The train hurling like a bullet through a gun barrel.  Ahead

          the tracks end, buried beneath the rubble of the collapsed

          tunnel.
Inside the rattling train, V lays in perfect repose.
Let me be there, Evey, when it
begins...
Hidden and alone, Evey pulls the mask from her face.
Please let me hear the music... one
last time... my music.
Almost unconsciously, Evey raises her hand and coaxes the
first soft notes as he had once done.
At first, you have to listen
carefully.
The violins of the 1812 overture steadily rise.
Ah, yes.  There it is.  Beautiful,
is it not?
Evey smiles, her hand still gently conducting.

INT.  SUBWAY With the clash of cymbals, the train crashes into the wall of rubble. EXT.  NEW GOVERNMENT BUILDING The entire building opens like a time-lapsed rose blooming with brilliant orange petals of flame. EXT.  CITY STREET The crowd is awash in the baptismal glow of erupting flame. EXT.  ROOFTOP Evey watches the explosion, a star-burst of flaming debris searing against the night sky like fireworks. EXT.  CITY STREET The masses burst through the barricades with a euphoric frenzy. EXT.  ROOFTOP The explosion begins to slowly die.

character.name: Yes, my love.  Yes it is.

dialogue.text: INT.  SUBWAY With the clash of cymbals, the train crashes into the wall of rubble. EXT.  NEW GOVERNMENT BUILDING The entire building opens like a time-lapsed rose blooming with brilliant orange petals of flame. EXT.  CITY STREET The crowd is awash in the baptismal glow of erupting flame. EXT.  ROOFTOP Evey watches the explosion, a star-burst of flaming debris searing against the night sky like fireworks. EXT.  CITY STREET The masses burst through the barricades with a euphoric frenzy. EXT.  ROOFTOP The explosion begins to slowly die.

segments.content: I know that there is only one way
to repay him for what he did.
She looks down at the mask.
And I know that that way is going
to take a lot of hard work.
She smiles.
I know this like I know the sun
will rise tomorrow and beneath that
new sun, our work will begin.
The fire fades and Evey turns, cradling the mask, and walks
away.
